data.title: Update MojoShader dependency
data.body: Fixes #3658.

data.title: Pipeline tool on OSX has incorrect permissions for ffmpeg and ffprobe
data.body: With the default install, I was getting a FileNotFoundException when trying to build an mp3 asset.  It turns out that the installer is placing the ffmpeg and ffprobe executables down without execute permissions.

data.title: Correct and fill out Android key mapping, add Apps key mapping on Windows
data.body:
Hi,

This PR fixes an issue with the Android keycode mapping (C/Z keys did not work correctly.) It also adds many more key mappings for Android, so function keys can be used.

The PR also adds the mapping for the key called "Apps" in XNA on Windows/OpenGL

Isaac

data.title: Correct loading certain SoundBanks on Android.
data.body:
Hi,

This PR addresses an issue where certain SoundBanks will not load on Android. The underlying issue is that FileStreams allow seeks past the end of the file, MemoryStreams, which are used on Android, do not.

Isaac

data.title: Monogame 3.3 Touch event is always moved
data.body:
I have installed Monogame 3.3.0.2238 but on Android/iOS when you try to detect touch all touch states are MOVED and sometimes the touch state is RELEASED, 1/300 is released.

Any idea why this is happening ?

I think it is not bad addition for Color.

If this addition is accepted - the https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/3587 could be rewritted to more compact form.

data.title: Minor fix for installer
data.body: Looks like missed description for vs2013 template.

data.title: .Fbx models animation issue
data.body: Hello, ***I have started porting my existing game engine from Xna to MonoGame recently. The process goes well and MonoGame looks very good but I have faced some issues. I will create 1 bug per issue. MonoGame 3.3.0.2238 Issue 2: .Fbx models animation issue The problem is that my .Fbx animations are not played correctly in MonoMage as they did in Xna. I use custom Skinned Model Processor and Animation Player based on XNA skinning sample (GPU). Please take a look at the FBX model: https://www.dropbox.com/s/c5618bvugosu128/Gate001.FBX?dl=0. It is created using 3D Stuio Max and is rendered well in both 3D Studio Max and official FBX Review software but when loaded in MonoGame and rendered using SkinnedEffect, model meshes are shifted and distorted. In Xna this model was rendering correctly. I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong, have you any ideas? Thank you!

data.title: Possible OpenGL depth range / clipping bug
data.body:
It's very possible that I'm missing something obvious.

But it seems to me that MonoGame does not account for the difference in NDC space between Direct3D and OpenGL.

In Direct3D, the Z-coordinate in NDC ranges from 0 to 1, while in OpenGL it ranges from -1 to 1. So in Direct3D, anything in NDC space with `z < 0` will be clipped, while in OpenGL anything in NDC space with `z < -1` will be clipped.

The `Matrix.CreateOrthographic*` and `Matrix.CreatePerspective` methods use Direct3D conventions, so the NDC depth range created by these methods is from 0 to 1.

As far as I can see, that means that MonoGame's OpenGL renderer only ever uses half of the available depth range. Worse, near plane clipping doesn't work properly, because objects that _should_ be behind the near clip plane, and therefore clipped, in fact aren't, because the near clip plane ends up (potentially) behind the camera. (That's how I noticed this bug - something that should have been clipped wasn't being clipped.)

The only mention I can find of this issue is over on FNA, here: flibitijibibo/FNA#282. @flibitijibibo mentioned a possible solution: `glClipControl`, and implemented it for FNA [here](https://github.com/flibitijibibo/FNA/commit/99019befdc4eb6d2de31706d0e89b7532affce3e), but it's only available in recent versions of OpenGL. You can also modify the `Matrix` methods that create projection matrices, but obviously that's not a general solution. @flibitijibibo has also added a note to the FNA docs about the issue, [here](https://github.com/flibitijibibo/FNA/wiki/2:-Building-with-FNA#depth-clipping-accuracy).

But I feel like I must be missing something, because surely this would have been noticed before now?

_(Note: MonoGame uses `posFixup` to account for the difference between Direct3D and OpenGL in the 0 location for the screen-space Y-coordinate. That's related to this, but it doesn't solve the NDC Z-coordinate problem.)_

data.title: Where to get the MonoGame 3.3 iOS assembly?
data.body:
I downloaded and installed MonoGame 3.3 for Visual Studio, but looks like the iOS files were not included; "C:\Program Files (x86)\MonoGame\v3.0\Assemblies\iOS" is empty. All of the other platform folders have the MonoGame.Framework.dll and associated files though. Am I missing something?

Before looking in this directory I tried using the NuGet package (since it worked for my Android and Windows 8 projects), but it gives the following error:

```
Installing 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.3.0.0'.
Successfully installed 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.3.0.0'.
Adding 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.3.0.0' to Xamarin.iOS Copy of DPSF.
Uninstalling 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.3.0.0'.
Successfully uninstalled 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.3.0.0'.
Install failed. Rolling back...
Could not install package 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.3.0.0'. You are trying to install this package into a project that targets 'MonoTouch,Version=v1.0', but the package does not contain any assembly references or content files that are compatible with that framework. For more information, contact the package author.
```

Any help is appreciated :)

data.title: MonoGame must be on the same disk as project
data.body:
I'm working on a MonoGame WindowsGL project with others.  Unlike them, I have two drives: my C: drive , and SSD to hold the OS and other programs, and my M: drive for data and programs.  MonoGame was installed to the C: drive for whatever reason.  I kept getting the error

`Could not copy the file M:\program files (x86)\monogame\v3.0\assemblies\windowsgl\sdl.dll because it was not found`

I couldn't change the .csproj file as some people recommended, as it would screw up my teammates code.  I moved my repo to the C: drive and the problem disappeared.

I'm not sure if this is a MonoGame issue or not, but it seems silly to me that the build process inserts the current drive into the include string instead of the correct drive.

data.title: Implement texture arrays for Direct3D
data.body:
Currently only implemented for Direct3D.

A prerequisite for OpenGL support is MojoShader support for texture array samplers in HLSL.

Fixes #3653.

data.title: Consider implementing / exposing texture arrays
data.body:
In Direct3D, there's an `ArraySize` property for textures, which I think would be really useful to expose:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/Texture2D.DirectX.cs#L363

```
desc.ArraySize = 1;
```

OpenGL has [array textures](https://www.opengl.org/wiki/Array_Texture), which look like the same thing (although not supported by OpenGL ES 2.0).

I think this could be a backwards-compatible change: if you want to `SetData` on one of these, you'd use the `level` parameter. You'd calculate the value for the `level` parameter using something similar to Direct3D's [D3D11CalcSubresource](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476081%28v=vs.85%29.aspx), which we'd need to expose as a new API.

If this looks like something that would be of interest, then I'd be happy to work on a PR. I just wanted to first see if it matches MG's goals.

(My use-case: for cascaded shadow maps, it's nice to use a Texture2D array. The alternative is to use a single texture containing all the shadow maps, with offsets to sample from the correct cascade. It's certainly do-able without texture arrays, but more elegant with them.)

data.title: iOS freeze & crash when attempting to resume following incoming call
data.body:
When returning to a monogame game having received a call, the game screen displays, but updates do not resume. After about 10 seconds, the game crashes and returns to the home screen.

This occurs in the latest stable monogame build and development versions from just before this point until now.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a new iOS Universal app in Xamarin studio
2) Set up a standard "cornflower blue" game1 boilerplate class and update the AppDelegate and Main.cs files to run this.
3) Modify the game1 update and draw calls so that the ongoing updates can be seen (I put in a simple timer to display gameTime.TotalGameTime on the draw call)
4) Run the app (I was using an iPhone 5c running iOS 8.1)
5) Call the phone running the app
6) When the phone running the app switches to display the incoming call, hang up
7) The phone running the app will now return to the app, but the display will no longer update. After about 10 seconds, the app will crash.

data.title: Merged WindowsGL and Linux KeyboardUtil and StorageDeviceHelper into one
data.body:
Things done:
  • WindowsGL has been set to use Linux KeyboardUtil class since the classes are almost the same, and Linux class has implemented DIctionary
  • Linux has been set to use WindowsGL StorageDeviceHelper since it's own StorageDeviceHelper was almost identical
